p: We also found a significant correlation between decreasing platelet count and increasing cfDNA concentration in dengue patients. Probably, it is associated with binding and subsequent platelet activation by DENV as reported previously [ 2, 41, 42]. Platelet activation is believed to release mitochondria [ 43], leading to elevated mitochondrial DNA in plasma [ 44], which in turn perhaps contributed to high cfDNA levels in dengue patients with decreasing platelet counts. Mitochondrial DNA released from platelet is also a potent inflammatory trigger which causes cytokines release and systematic inflammation [ 43]. This pro-inflammatory response might also play a role in dengue clinical outcomes.
